summary: Adds a player home inside Whiterun just underneath the bridge in front of the entrance/exit.
descriptionHtml:
[center][size=2][color=#00ff00][i]
[b]*This is one of my first mods for Skyrim, so tips and problem reporting would be greatly appreciated.*
*If you want to use my mod or any of its files in your own creation, please feel free to do so. All I ask is that you give me credit.*[/b][/i][/color][/size]

[u][color=#980000][size=6][b]Abandoned Cellar[/b][/size][/color][/u][i]
[/i][size=4]
Twin Daedric Lords, The Seers, as they call themselves, have been trying to set a foothold in Skyrim. Starting in Whiterun, they managed to get a cult going, even if it was only three members. However, as the days passed, the visits to the shrine dwindled to the point that the Seers were being starved of what they craved most: Souls. The Shrine is now known as the Abandoned Cellar and the only way to get into it is by acquiring one of the only three keys in existence. Once inside, you'll be able to take over this shrine and call it your very own home.[/size][/center]

[center][size=3]The three keys mentioned above belong to: Heimskr, Nazeem, and Farengar. You can choose to either kill Heimskr and Nazeem or just pickpocket them for their key. However, if you wish to not partake in those kind of shady actions, just take Farengar's key, it's on the desk in his study room. The Abandoned Cellar that the keys belong to is underneath Whiterun's bridge just as you are walking into the city or trying to leave it. At the beginning of this whole ordeal, the three cultists had fitted the Shrine to beome a home because they had spent much of their time in there. The house is fitted for both vamps and non-vamps and it comes with:[/size][/center][size=3]
[/size]
[list]
[*][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=2]Vampire Coffin[/size][/font]
[*][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=2]Bedroll[/size][/font]
[*][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=2]Lots of storage and each are named. (YES EVERYTHING IS SAFE STORAGE!)[/size][/font]
[*][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=2]Alchemy Table[/size][/font]
[*][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=2]Enchanting Table[/size][/font]
[*][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=2]Blacksmithing Anvil[/size][/font]
[*][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=2]Smelter[/size][/font]
[*][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=2]Tanning Rack[/size][/font]
[*][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=2]Grindstone[/size][/font]
[*][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=2]Workbench[/size][/font]
[*][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=2]Staff Enchanter/Workbench[/size][/font]
[/list]
[center][size=3]There is also a human who looks like a vampire held up within a cage. Her name is Elvira and is a perfect snack for the player. If you don't wish to feed off of her or you just like having Potions of Blood, there is an Altar of Blood. It's a magical bowl that never empties no matter how many times you bottle up that lovely crimson liquid.

[u]This mod requires:[/u][/size][/center]
[list]
[*][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=2]Skyrim[/size][/font]
[*][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=2]Dawnguard[/size][/font]
[*][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=2]Dragonborn[/size][/font]
[/list][center][size=3][u]
Credits:[/u][/size][/center]
[list]
[*][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=2]Bethesda[/size][/font]
[*][size=2][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/games/users/7393436/?]Fierydemon30[/url] - He helped me so much with figuring out Creation Kit and Nifskope.[/size]
[/list][size=3][u]
[/u][/size][center][size=3][u]My Other Mods:[/u][/size][/center]
[list]
[*][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=2][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/74632?]Staff of the Seers[/url] (If you want the original mod the house was in.)[/size][/font]
[/list]
author: Mazthoril
